7csdWdMLfcJzY6UdDW6GFQ.text: We had a tremendous experience last Monday before and after the Panthers game.  We ate a few bites, especially enjoying the kale chips and the mac and cheese (surprisingly since we are rare to find a good mac and cheese).  We also appreciated the wine selection on top of the cocktail choices.  Our server was attentive despite the crowd and the GM offered us a nice greeting.  Most of all, the setting is outstanding, inside and out.  The views are great but the decor really offers a lot and makes us say (sorry but it's still True), we don't even feel like we're in Charlotte!

CTl_8qkMohdTUw8-kQ2JQQ.text: The cocktails are pricey but what you would expect for an upscale rooftop bar uptown. I think it's worth it for the atmosphere and would love to come back during a Knights game since it overlooks the stadium.

HtnxWQ4aPUBrLPBHKpgwjA.text: Turned away because my friend wasn't wearing the proper shoes and then turned away again the next night because my husband was wearing the proper shoes. Please! After attending Charlotte City Club, which has a dress code and then arriving at Merchant and Trade and being turned away due to shoes! Come on! Unfortunately, my friends and I won't be back. Oh well. Good luck.

9y8-_5AJjt74YaCPQWGZ7w.text: We stood in line for over thirty minutes with completely drunk people screaming only to get in and realize that the wait for drinks was longer than the wait to get in. The door staff also could be more hospitable to those wanting to get into their venue.

0IG1I5ei0QXzNOQAH7XZMQ.text: Talk about poor service...avoid this place.  DJ is out of control with crazy loud music to the point you cannot think.  Drinks are stupid over priced..$16 for house wine????  Manager could have cared less about our requests to reduce the piercing music.  Other tables around us were just as frustrated.

JF7oJljoghACqglKhQJkMA.text: Show up in a suit right after work and you're good to go. You'll pay an extra $3-5 per drink, but it's a very nice rooftop bar with a beautiful view. Better than Fahrenheit and City Lights Social in my opinion. The staff was friendly the first time I went, but a little pretentious the second time around.  My second visit didn't go so well. We showed up in dress shoes, slacks, sweaters, and light jackets and were turned away at 9pm on a Friday. Apparently there is a "strict collared shirts" policy, even though it was 45 degrees in late November (and it's a rooftop bar exposed to the elements). Also, the social program manager is someone I know from his days at Hotel Van Zandt / Geraldine's in Austin, having lived there for five years, and he was completely unwilling to accommodate us because of the lack of "collared shirts". A hotel guest was refused immediately after us because he was wearing sneakers. I don't know this guy, but he was paying a premium to stay at a Kimpton boutique hotel and couldn't even get a drink at the hotel bar. I've never seen such a thing anywhere else, and I travel 2-3 weeks per month for work. "Sorry you didn't pack dress shoes" was the bouncer's way of addressing that situation, and it's pretty much on par for the greeting you should expect at Merchant and Trade. Reminds me of that movie Date Night - Claw, you're welcome!

HU4EICevk2RUHsAmBP9uQA.text: 4 stars because if you go to a place like this, you really should be smart enough realize what you're getting to begin with - expensive drinks, people who want to be seen, etc.  If this wasn't a really awesome rooftop, I'd f***ing hate this place.  And, I probably won't go back anytime soon.  But, I do recommend that you go, at least once, because it's a really awesome view.

16DfCvbczhWM4xi8VH9dTw.text: Not worth the time. But if you decide to give it a try make sure you dress to the nines or they might not let you in.

zQTDb_1-SpCfwzq6I4k_5Q.text: We had a party of 6 and wanted to get drinks and dinner and they turned us away because one of the members in our party was wearing (nice) sneakers. They said they had a strict dress code. Guess we will be taking our business elsewhere.

Xy3zliPBAH5HSFf7_L6MVQ.text: First off, we started inside and our server Kate was fantastic! She was very patient and knowledgeable of the menu, quick service and great personality. We really enjoyed her. Then we decided to go outside and everything changed. This thin blonde server, I am unaware of her name because she was so rude, she was the worst server we have ever had. We're both former workers of the hospitality industry and could not believe this girl. We had to wave her over to order a drink, and she asked so rudely what my husband wanted  - as if it was annoying to her that we were asking. Then she got the drink and slammed it on the table and ran away. I really couldn't believe in a upper scale type of environment that a server was acting like this. If you hate your life when assisting people with their food and drink, do something else! So thanks Kate for your service, along with the good drinks and ambiance of the place we will be back. But we will make sure to steer clear of the other server, as their job is important to provide a good experience.

wmYjQ7b7sPhBQq5hX_knCA.text: Why would anyone go here? When you arrive, you get treated like garbage by the door staff. They are a bunch of condescending thugs that make you feel like a criminal....for no reason. They use some ambiguous "no sporty shoe" policy to randomly select who actually gets the privilege to get inside. I see them turn away people with great non-sporty shoes and I've seen others in there with nikes. It makes no sense and makes me wonder if they are being bribed or discriminating. Anyway, waiting in this line is like playing roulette. If you are allows to enter, the food is poor....just a greasy, salty overpriced mistake. We ordered a bunch of dishes and nothing was remotely good. The view was nice, but pretty much any rooftop bar has one. Drinks are fine, but who can't make a good cocktail in 2018?....and of course, they are overpriced. I say...respect yourself and save your money. Avoid this place like the plague.

xqPCqW2xzfk5FwBr-92TlA.text: The place is nice, vibrant, with more of cosmopolitan feel to it (compared to other CLT's hot spots). I would give 5 stars but the hostesses need some training on how to be nicer and more accommodating. They definitely don't do their job the way they should.

aNqRw_crlK-3WzFsyUIKQQ.text: Merchant and Trade is another example of how well the Kimpton brand sets its standards!! This place is absolutely amazing!! Stepping into the elevator to make the journey up to the rooftop's reveal is worth the wait! Great drinks, class and elegance also mix style and sexiness. Finally a big city vibe so needed in Charlotte. I travel everywhere for work, and I make it a point to at least visit a Kimpton property when I am in a different city. Charlotte, you are lucky to have this company in your town. It is obvious from the minute that you walk into a Kimpton property, customer service and a sense of pride is always present. You definitely set the bar high for future properties in the Queen City!!

nTqEGRMluk3ZNU27mrjoEw.text: First off, you have to wait in a line just to get to the restaurant which took about 45 minutes. When we finally got up the elevator to our seats, it took a good 15 minutes to even be noticed by a server. My girlfriend ordered a martini that was less than two ounces and costed $14 and honestly just tasted like pineapple juice. I ordered the fried chicken sauce trio and my girlfriend ordered the coffee rubbed steak with potato strings. Our food arrived within an acceptable amount of time, but my fried chicken came in a basket (?) with zero sides and zero sauces. And to add to that monstrosity, the chicken was raw in the inside. My girlfriends steak tasted decent but was smaller than a iPhone and the potato strings were burnt. The bill came out to be about $75 for drinks and subpar food. The only reason why I'm giving this place two stars is because the ambiance is really cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

AjfN1wdBCvkpZj5rFzTFuQ.text: Watch your drink orders and get a receipt!    If you don't order a specific type of liquor, they will pour top-shelf liquor.  $48 for two doubles, and an automatic 20% gratuity for not closing out your tab.  (which I didn't request that they leave open)  We had to leave suddenly due to a friend's medical emergency.  I saw the charge and called Nick, the GM.  Promised to look into it and call back, never did. Left three more messages, no call back.  Finally contacted the manager Genna and explained what happened. She was very responsive and sent a copy of my receipt, saying Nick would call me.  No call back.

htKPrzmaxEjw3y_9G0huBQ.text: The vibe + the view + the bubbles. What more could we ask for? Checked out this rooftop bar/lounge with hopes that it matched all the buzz we've hearing. And it did! Great spot to grab drinks and catch up with friends or nice pre/ post dinner drinks with with a view. The server was even nice enough to bring us a blanket as the night air started getting a little cooler. Can't wait to check out this place in the warmer seasons.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

yKcPnozfLcD9cFxA6BnrHw.text: I truly enjoyed my visit to Merchant and Trade this evening visiting here from Oakland California the view was quite lovely the atmosphere so welcoming yes drinks are pricey but you get what you pay for will definitely be back on my next visit to Charlotte

hHoZirKQiDiSbv-SLTxmcA.text: Merchant & Trade is exactly what you'd expect from another uptown, rooftop bar.  We waited for about 20 minutes to get in on Friday (around 6pm). Once escorted up to the 19th floor of the hotel, the doors opened to a well-decorated bar and indoor/outdoor seating area. As far as rooftop bar decor goes, I think Merchant & Trade slays the other options in Charlotte. They've used a navy and green theme to give it a vibrant feel while providing an overall relaxed environment. Seating options include rocking chairs, coaches, benches, stools, and everything in-between. The view is GREAT, especially if you want to watch a Knights game while drinking overpriced cocktails instead of overpriced beer (oh wait, they have that too!).  The drink and food menu were pretty average compared to its peer institutions. I'd been really hoping for a knockout cocktail menu, but they only had a handful of options, none of which sounded appealing to either my guy or me (and we have pretty different palates). The wine menu is okay, and they've got a good selection of liquors. Like many other uptown locales, you can buy a local craft brew for twice as much as you'll pay for it at the brewery its made at.  The food menu had some promise, and I hope they'll expand it. There were only a handful of appetizers, a few larger dishes, and a couple desserts. The lavash we had was really good, but I would've loved to get something more substantial here. Their vegetarian options were lacking, which is why I hope they'll start offering more selections.  Definitely worth one trip for the view and ambiance. I think it would make a great first date locale!

_vVR1R1qxXi_eGG87aH0jg.text: With a pretentiousness far beyond their depth, a team of brutes treat patrons horrifically. I can no longer bring clients there as they decline entrance on absurd grounds. They patrol the bar with earpieces, as if they were secret service dropouts, and are hyper vigilant when its uncalled for and offensive. The physical space is wonderful, it's unfortunate they ruin it with a sense of undeserved importance and exclusiveness bordering on discrimination. If you're looking for a Charlotte rooftop bar with more hospitable and friendly staff, check out Nuvole. Or, if you  can forgo the rooftop views, Angelines is at the base of the same building as Mercenaries & Tyrants and infinitely more hospitable.

dWz8Gzz2Zd6Me-6pHgpsSQ.text: This space is absolutely gorgeous! It didn't feel like I was in Charlotte. The space is very chic and modern. We were greeted buy a friendly door man and elevator hostess. Once we arrived, we were greeted again by the hostess that seated us outside. The covered patio area have a beautiful view of Knights Stadium and beyond. The dj played a mix of house and techno music that wasn't obnoxious. With all of those glows, I'm giving M&T three stars because the table service was sub par. Our waitress was mediocre at best. She came off as cold and inattentive. I don't know if there were special cocktails because we were just handed the menu and she walked off. They carry a wide variety of spirits and the prices are about the same at similar venues. I will return to M&T and hopefully I'll be seated in a section with a friendlier waitress.

hNO656uxPgrKP1YKqdreBQ.text: Worst experience ever . Ruined our nights .  Went to this place for our friends bday , my friends had a table but that didn't matter . So, when we got to the line , we told the line guy about the tables, we were rejected... that's ok since I understand sometimes a table doesn't mean anything  The line was out of control , we had to wait about 1 hour , we thought "wow it must be really busy up there " no problem we will wait...  - 1 hour later , nobody from upstairs came down so we figured it it was packed .. -Another 15 mins later and we finally went upstairs - IT WAS EMPTY!!!!!! -We tried to other a drink - we decided to cancel the order after waiting 20 mins AT THE BAR  -We went outside to the patio ... it stunk like the sewer line was just there .  I was visiting Charlotte for my friends bday and this is probably one of the worst places . We went to QC Social after and that place got us in a much better mood

ecpB_TWE3dhPQsKbyPVFiA.text: I gave this restaurant five stars because my experience was great from start to finish. We had no problems with the doorman or the dress code upon entrance; the dress code is listed on the website and VERY easy to follow. They were not as strict as the complaints lead me to believe, just look nice and you won't have a problem! The hostesses were great as well.   We had 4 people in our group in total and had to wait about 10 minutes to be sat which gave us time to look around and take advantage of the view. The inside is small and cozy which is perfect for social interaction.   After being sat, our waitress greeted us and gave drink suggestions she was very helpful and polite. We ordered burgers, kale chips, wings, crab rolls, and tater tots. Everything was AMAZING considering the small selection and interesting ingredients and my cocktail was delicious. No complaints at all, we had a great experience from start to finish and will be returning.

HK0Nsj8X-SQgXUQwLAHSXA.text: My wife and I were staying downtown a few weeks ago and went to Merchant and Trade before dinner. We had the egg rolls and they were amazing. The old fashioned may be one of the best old fashioned I've ever had! We went to dinner then came back for after dinner night cap.  We ordered whatever the bar tender recommended and again, amazing. The ambience, service was simply amazing! Don't think. Go. All other places for drinks in Charlotte is a giant lol.

AZHQLihRwSDlG943hT1yMA.text: Fun for the view, but overall poor service.  They close at 1:30, 30 minutes early every Saturday. Better off going to any other rooftop in Charlotte.

LZhg7pITDNcLq2RBlhGylw.text: Charlotte's new rooftop bar!  It's like most swanky rooftop bars you find in Charlotte. Fire pits, beautiful views, fancy cocktails, people in business attire and SLOW service.  I'm hoping this will improve because this place has the best views in Charlotte.  On one side you are looking straight at BB&T park and then on another you see the infamous BOA tower. They do have a strict dress code, so you might want to read up on it before you head there for a cocktail.   Coolest Feature:  Retractable roof for inclement weather.  That's right....Rain or Shine you can enjoy a rooftop in Charlotte.  It's worth giving it a try.  Enjoy!

CNHfOEo5rLVra-YCjI9Pmg.text: Personally I love this place! I've read through a lot of reviews and most of the complaints are about the line being so long but to be honest, it's not that big of a space for how many people wanting to drink there and the bar itself is relatively small to be making so many (craft cocktail) drinks. Only allowing a certain capacity to fill that area makes your individual experience better when you do get up there! I think the service was friendly and efficient too and the food is small portioned but very tasteful! It's a very unique and classy spot, worth dressing up, taking skyline pics and enjoying charlottes best cocktails.

R_Zp-4WVjulJJ83IwqN1uQ.text: Went to Merchant & Trade for a Friday night out with the girls. We arrived around 8:15, there wasn't a wait and we were able to grab a table for 4.   We had cocktails and a few small plates. Great vibes and views overlooking Romare Bearden Park.   There was a DJ playing house music.

NMtHC3iH34hZ647F-ZPQHQ.text: Love this place! Great atmosphere and staff! You can beat an evening hanging out on the patio!

E3qI4P0uQB2bhExiA_Ig9A.text: We went to Merchant & Trade after the Carolina/Baltimore game and we were staying at the Kimpton. I don't know if it is usually that crazy busy after a home game, but if it is I suggest more staff for the occasions. Elia, behind the bar was a complete sweetheart. You could tell she was very stressed being by herself and the customers she was dealing with did not help her situation. For the extremely long wait, she was able to comp our first round of drinks. The General Manager was also very kind and I saw him helping her out, however there was someone else, a bar back perhaps, named Taylor? He was very rude to our bartender and should not be talking like that to his fellow employees in front of guests where they can overhear his major attitude problem. It was a major turnoff and not a professional look for somewhere that is striving to be in a luxury market.

BW7Onx4gXRKl01xjQh4jrQ.text: On top of the breathtaking view M&T has a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The service from the moment you get into the elevator up to the main lobby is excellent, greeted with a smile and everyone looked very poised yet fun. Now for the good stuff, the food and drinks were fantastic. The blushing bell cocktail is so good I came back the next day for another drink. The food is also delicious, presented just as beautiful as the drinks. Would recommend going here for a special night in Charlotte.

First, we had to be in line for almost 1 hr to get in ( we thought the place was packed inside) when we finally went up , turns out the place was nearly empty, so what's the hold up ? QWZFWxN2cPK9UTMBaxBH4g.text: I've been dying to try this place and made it a stop on a Charlotte tour with visitors on Saturday. We were wearing casual brewery clothes (think flannels, etc) and they let us in around 4pm. Based on other reviews they probably would not have let us in at a later hour. We were seated right away and I love the ambiance and the decorations. Very classy and well put together. Our waitress was friendly and attentive. We ordered cocktails and I ordered tater tots. The cocktails were very good, but the tots might have changed my life. They were huge and hand made and gourmet and yum. I really want to come back here after work dressed up and enjoy properly after dark. My guests loved the views. I only remove one star because the doorman was a little much for 4pm on a Saturday. Will definitely come back and I also can't wait to try Angeline's.

hSzwUVNLWJNwdXZNV6AsMQ.text: Honestly, Honestly very disappointed. I definitely would have to say this place is over hyped. I went there one night with friends and though the atmosphere was a very chill environment and the baseball game had just ended so there were some fireworks, I didn't love merchant and trade. I wasn't impressed with the food... my drink though pretty was just okay. Did I mention the line to get in ... it's absolutely crazy and once you get in you have to wait again to get food service( 45 mins to get in plus another 30 to order) . The wait staff wasn't that all to friendly either, maybe I just went on a bad night , however I did not enjoy my experience there.

4BcjiHx-omXp2CdkxUt9Dw.text: Merchant & Trade nailed it here! I've frequented Kimpton Hotels and their luxurious spaces when visiting D.C so my expectations were already high. Until visiting M&T, The Donovan's Rooftop was my favorite, the pool, the view and the service was all just spot on. Upon entry Brandon greeted me at the door and wished us a great evening, once upstairs the music was alive and the drinks were flowing. You immediately get greeted off the elevator and taken back by how large the space actually is. The "grassy" dance floor with the DJ booth, the sections, THE VIEW! It appeared there was a nook for whatever type of experience you wanted. Seated, standing, dancing, grouped together with friends, or just solo and taking in the view. I love the energy from staff and Kate assisted me all evening with drinks. Some beers are a bit pricier here than at other venues but you're paying for an experience, a view and class. This isn't a dive bar, bring your best threads and some spending money. Treat yourself, you deserve it.   I will say this place could benefit with a mobile bar maybe near the DJ booth. If you don't have a waiter or waitress then you'll be waiting at the bar for some time. Just a small bar that has beers ready to go especially as this place gets busier this summer.   Outside of that, great work. A little jealous I'll prolly never experience the hotel part since I actually LIVE in Charlotte and LOVE Kimpton but happy to have M&T when friends visit. Maybe I'll get to do a staycation one day. All in all, two thumbs up here.

VNSXSjagrKM__TBCmDudmA.text: Views, Views, Views. This is the "IT" spot for 2018. It just opened up and is located on top of the Kimpton Hotel. The rooftop spot overlooks Romare Beardon Park and the baseball field in Uptown. It also has a great skyline view of the city.  There's a wrap around outdoor patio with fire pits, rocking chairs, and soft seating. Inside, there is a large bar and more seating.  Tip: There is a dress code that they strictly enforce.

BTB6GKVNbuJZjzyFIvYIcA.text: We went out downtown for my wife's birthday and had plans to hit another venue for drinks prior to our dinner reservation that fell through so we wound up at Merchant and Trade. We were really impressed with the layout of everything in the restaurant, and even though it was cloudy, and cold outside it was still a great view. The bartenders greeted us as soon as we sat down, and were really prompt in answering our questions. They told us the drink menu changes almost quarterly, and even though it had just changed, they were very knowledgeable about the drinks and made great recommendations. My wife had the Nakatomi tower and I had the Bananarama. Both were exceptional, we will most definitely be back before the drink menu changes.

UBa7Zxky3zXHCcf3U5a5MQ.text: went on Thursday night and they had dj playing who was great.  We waited a short time to be seated outside which was sooo worth it for the view.  Our server was great drinks and food were good.  tacos and the burger were very tasty can't wait to go back again

qwYEQO6WYyth0MVKatRHbA.text: This is one place in town that has one of the best scenery's. We have been talking about coming here since they opened and just now making our way here. Merchant and trade is an upscale restaurant and lounge with a view of Charlotte's skyline and facing the ball park stadium . We were meeting friends for dinner somewhere else so we stopped in to have a drink. The ambiance was on point. This place makes for the perfect selfies. Sorry can't tell you much about the food since we actually didn't eat dinner here. I will put merchant and trade on my list of go to places for the summer because I am the rooftop queen in the summer and spring so look forward to seeing more of myself and friends.

e_c_RqhwxrrbH5H3nK5XTg.text: I have been twice and can only say this place is a bit of a mixed bag. The first time we went the bouncer warned my significant other that his brand new converse were not strictly dress code and he would let him in this time but next time he might not get in. We went around 2pm on a Saturday so I assumed they let him in because it wasn't busy and he was wearing a suit jacket. The next time we went was at night and we got fancy dressed up but saw several people not dressed to impress (including cut off shorts with threads hanging loose). A dress code is one thing but it seems like it is haphazardly enforced at best.   When we went in the afternoon we sat at the bar and admired the beautiful views while the bartender mixed delightful cocktails. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable and recommended drinks that were to our taste. The beet it was my favorite and a $1 from each drink was advertised as going to charity. All in it was a lovely afternoon with an impressive view.   At night we were shuffled to a small table that had zero air flow. Air flow is essential to sitting outside in the summer in NC and our water glasses were empty most of the time. Drinks took forever as well. Not a huge deal because it was busy and we were waiting on a group of friends anyway. After we had been there about an hour and had two drinks a new waitress dropped off our check and told us our waitress had gone home and could we please close out. We left the check and a card on the table for over 30 minutes waiting on someone to pick it up when our friends arrived. We grabbed the check and the card to go say hi figuring we would close out at the bar because we would have to go there for our next round of drinks anyway. Almost immediately our original waitress materialized demanding we close out! And I noticed she was there until closing so I would have assumed they wanted our table, except it sat empty the rest of the night. Strange.  TD:DR - lovely first experience in the afternoon. Not a great vibe on the second nighttime visit.

mfsTRhUNBKv9ZQd5_ejbCQ.text: Arrived last night with a party of 6. We were ready to eat, drink, and enjoy the beautiful night on the roof top. The doorman refused my entry because he felt my sneakers fell under the "athletic wear" category, which he stated was against their dress code. The dress code on their website specifically says "high-end, clean sneakers are allowed, provided they are complimented by appropriate attire". I was wearing brand new, very clean, all white sneakers. On my phone I showed him the dress code posted right on their own website and he still sent us away. We ended up having a great time at a different rooftop bar down the street. M&T should communicate their dress code with their staff and patrons more clearly, or better yet, just say "no sneakers" in their posted dress code so others don't get sent away for the same reason.

n7WrFLL4OjD4SxGj6aS14g.text: Fun spot to grab a drink. Inside and outside bars have comfortable seating.   We went late afternoon on a hot day. If you want to sit outdoors sit in the side areas, they are much cooler,  they get a breeze.

ka94FhDFnbzloWeUfjbviw.text: Ooh la la, Merchant & Trade is hands down my new favorite spot in uptown Charlotte. Entertaining out of towners on a weekday night, I decided to give M&T a try after seeing it pop up on my Yelp feed. I went with a group of four on a Thursday night. We were seated right away around 8:00 ish in a dimly lit open room with thumping music that wasn't overpowering. We didn't have to scream to have a conversation. The waitress was over immediately and took our drink orders. We had a blueberry cider, as I'm not a beer drinker that was delicious. Good pour, $7. The waitress made great recommendations and we had kale chips, wings, and the lobster rolls. Kale chips ($9) melted in my mouth. Very airy, as all decent kale chips are. Wings were a little suspect, as I've never seen a wing shaped like a ball at the end of a bone, but they were decent. I would not get the wings in the future. Last were the lobster rolls. I was expecting a lobster egg roll, but the mini sandwiches were GREAT. We shared, so I only had one. The dish came with two rolls ($17 A little steep), but they were fresh and I had no regrets except that I couldn't keep it all to myself.  The best part of Merchant and Trade was the atmosphere. They did a great job with decor and the crowd was 30+ which is nice. Very sexy vibe and you can make it a date night, or come with friends to hang out. There were plenty of post work groups. Long story short, I'll be returning to Merchant & Trade soon.

5k6CmWaamrS1iE0HKxO7uQ.text: In town for business with a very large group! We got here with 30 people ready for food and drinks, but we were turned away do to some of us not having "proper" shoes. Yeezy's apparently are not allowed. We got here at 630pm on a Wednesday night! The girl was very rude in the way she turned away our group! Very bad customer service! Ink and ivy is getting our money!

qzATJlwOYk5XgxbumlT7Eg.text: Come here for the view. It's an upscale rooftop bar for drinks and appetizers, but they're definitely overpriced. The view overlooks Romare Bearden Park and the BB&T stadium, so is opposite of the city, but still makes for great pictures of the sunset.

Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

F8SiboYCfRMFoWdMels0rA.text: Absolutely beautiful rooftop area and comfortable chairs. It's more than able to accommodate large parties. The prices are a bit on the heavy side but the experience made up for it. I loved the cocktails and the best appetizer was the Cuban sandwich. I will definitely be back just for that sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Foot Long Cubano delicious
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Large rooftop area

HINq-Or6aqkJ6wZjFAohjA.text: Dropped in here to check out the views and grab a drink. Apparently its new, the views and the place is spectacular, cocktails at least the price point was up there. So settled for two prosecco's i believe it was $10 a pop, along with some chicken tenders. Cool place, it wasnt busy on labor day weekend.

9pMsJSKedcY9luuv_Mi0EA.text: This place was cool, but I wasn't terribly impressed with the menu or selection of drinks. You definitely are paying for the view.   It seemed excessive to have someone check our ids and a separate person to let us on the elevator before 5 on a weekday. Once we arrived inside, I liked the fire place and the space outside seemed nice, but it was Late December so we stayed indoors. Once it struck 5, the lights dimmed and made it hard to read the menu, but staff brought out some table lights-- that looked like dumbbells.   The fries were good, and my prosecco was good too, but nothing too special.

e2orXH5o_ginPL1dB3OYOQ.text: We specifically walked down to this part of town last Saturday to come here. There were about 20 people in a line that wasn't moving. I've read the reviews about fake lines, so we just walked by. Instead our group spend a collect several hundred dollars at Belfast / Cotton Room, which is great btw.  Around 11:30 there was no line here so we tried to come back again. AFTER checking everyone's IDs they told us we couldn't go up because one person in our party was wearing "athletic shoes." Funny thing was, we were all dressed really nice. We'd been to a nice dinner at Malabar. He and his gf has been to Blumenthal for a show. Apparently he was dressed nice enough for Blumenthal but not for a cheesy hotel bar. Skip it, just skip this place entirely. We then went to 204 North which is great also and spent several hundred dollars there sipping craft drinks and single barrel bourbons. This place missed out on probably $500 in sales from our one party. They don't want your money.

6UjmTnjUMVUlWHhHqzbI4g.text: So I decided to give Merchant and Trade another try after my first experience, which was not good. I had several friends and family members in town for my wedding a few weeks ago so we decided to meet there for drinks.   Pros - drinks were great, atmosphere was upbeat and fun.   Cons - inconsistent billing practices. One group had their card charged for their full bill mid visit. When they asked the waitress why she informed them that they needed "to confirm there were funds available, as they've had people not cover their bills". This would be ok, if it happened to everyone there, let alone our party. But it did not. In fact, no one else in our party was treated the same.   Overall, I think this is an ok place. Good concept, fun drinks (though a little pricey). However, as with several places in Charlotte, I think they struggle with diversity and handling large groups of diverse people. I recognize this is a strong statement, and refrained from including it in my first review (although I felt the same after that visit). However, we were a very diverse group of people (mostly of color) and had a very different experience than our non-diverse guests. It's unfortunate given the diversity Charlotte is seeing, and will continue to see. Businesses should work to ensure all guests experiences are consistent, regardless of background/makeup.   That said, if you're looking for a nice rooftop vibe and good drinks Merchant and Trade will deliver. Unfortunately, I don't plan to be back or to host another group there in the near future. I'm not a fan of inconsistency.

krUvJKmBu7lAKgMGuvwXEQ.text: Most of the food is appetizers which is fine because you go for the drinks and the view. They have live music on a few nights and the "vibe" is cool. Make sure you go on a night that is in your age group since you can quickly be either too old or young for the scene.

n-uyLcNNn5UCT36Rh3eMqQ.text: Great vibe! The best views! The wait to get up was ok, the line moved fairly quickly and once up stairs while packed not crammed in like sardines, and the not so packed that service suffered. Can't wait to go back we had a blast!

yPYphaNseuwEMmhtRoHWfg.text: Candace is the best server!!!! She took care of us so well!!!! I enjoyed my experience at merchant and trade. Will def come back as long as she is my server!!

ivOIlqZ-NoEYTKpP1cvVxA.text: We went in with a group on a saturday night and they said we couldnt get in because we had laced up shoes.  The person was extrmeley rude about it. We sat outside for 5 min and they  let a group of guys with laced shoes in???

Iu-7TdzFchbzQxgDrcZdag.text: It's a nice vibe but it's too much of a forced club scene into a bar atmosphere. I'm excited to go and check out the outside area in the summer though. I really loved my drink but too pricey for the atmosphere.

6fHpSVutlD56fTIfEo07pw.text: This place must really hate money. We were a party of 8 out for my birthday. A couple of friends had tickets to see The Book of Mormon, so they met us after the show. When we first arrived, there was a line; which I've heard they intentionally do this to create a fake demand. Finding this ridiculous nonsense, we went around the corner to Belfast Mill (I highly recommend this bar if you ever have a chance) where each of us had 2-3 drinks. Deciding at this point to grab one more drink before calling it a night, we decided to try Merchant & Trade one more time. There was no line so we went into the building. Security checked my ID but then decided to turn us away because our friends who had been to the show were wearing "athletic shoes". It should be noted that we all were dressed to have had dinner at a very nice restaurant and gone to a show at Blumenthal, so we took our money to a different bar where we bought 2-3 more cocktails.

0ErTshbMhZQnV_z0_y82DQ.text: Great view... Best part about it. Very loud inside,  limited menu. Drinks expensive. Service was good. I was really expecting more with all the good chatter/reviews...

wt21yDeStlBfvDT_VJl9bQ.text: We ate at Angeline which was amazing. The roof bar was really nice. Go at night. They have fire pits.

6eujGt79y6AMXTkpT-yEsQ.text: Jaw-dropping view, comparable to Fahrenheit.  Their food menu is short, but the items we ordered were very good.  The most unique outdoor seating that makes you feel like you're on vacation.  Service was fantastic.

6mIgxyg45eXBSoVofP-UKA.text: DO NOT EAT HERE! DRINKS ONLY! They have a small menu of small plates but the food was horrible. The chicken wings had zero flavor at all-very bland. The tater tots were not good either and I'm not sure how you mess that up. The view and layout of the facility are beautiful and has a great outdoor space. This place is perfect for drinks. Maybe they should ditch the food idea entirely.  I think the reviews would be much better if they just capitalized on drinks, the space, and the view.

uRpCNIHyFI87cFZV_guuMQ.text: Love this new Uptown spot. The view is awesome and overlooks the Romare Bearden Park. It's nice and roomy. I suggest going on a weekday as the weekends it is packed and a little hard to get in. I will definitely be back.

O1pehmK0w0dC1nuniit9eA.text: Classy. Hip. Contemporary. Stellar views. Charlotte is a metropolitan city and ought to have places like this. I'm sure the lines will die down as this place settles in to the uptown nightlife scene and the "newness wears off." I agree with the other reviewer - this is not New York City. It's better. M&T is not trying to be anything but what we are - kudos. This place will thrive. And, Charlotteans, it is okay to have a few places which have a higher standard of dress code than backward baseballs caps and jeans with holes in them. There are plenty of places you can patronize for that.

GFPUJzhcvbh087hGnmHXVw.text: We had a good experience, at this place the rooftop views and the place is probably the best so far in the city for a restaurant bar lounge. We haven't had the food yet but this is a definite keeper so far I'll keep you posted

P79da-JpwYhVWfAYCkGZlg.text: Not impressed! It's deece, but not the nice classy establishment I was hoping for.   Very small place.  You can tell it's going to fizzle down. The outside furniture is cheezy with a green tarp my dog would probably enjoy.  The inside doesn't have a great "feel."  You know one when you walk in and this place doesn't have it.   Promise.

3aLywedYKkgzooj7FmdP2g.text: Saw pictures of this place online and it looked great. Amazing scenery. The one thing going for this place is that the view is great being located on the rooftop overlooking Charlotte but that's about the extent of what this place has going for it. I recommend going once the sun goes down because there is no shade on this rooftop and you will fry. It's super hot temperature wise. Really dumb planning from an architectural standpoint because it renders the space almost useless in the summer or when it's sunny. On top of that the service and food was absolutely the worst. I would not go back.

S8imX8g5CUPlqs8nULDi8g.text: Dress code sucks. A colleague had writing on his tee shirt so wouldn't let us in. This is 2018!

h_XpkOQjGIiXWTKeNqVPLA.text: This place is a joke!  The bouncers are rude and the the food is way overpriced for what you get.  I feel bad for the servers bc it doesn't seem like management gives them a chance to succeed.  I was excited to visit, seeing how the city doesn't have many spots like this but in the end, the whole experience was very disappointing. It had kind of a trashy pretentious feel, which was a little strange seeing how most spots just know they're either/or and own it.  Def better bars/restaurants to spend your money in and around Charlotte that won't make you stand in a line for 30+ mins just to make you think they're busy.  Even with the views, I wouldn't recommend.

uW7R9MMvg8mwKHgSjQD46Q.text: Terrible place, they have the worst service, terrible food.  Definitely would not recommend!  Angeline's below is much better.  Avoid wasting time in line and at his place.  Much better bars with roof tops!

BGLaXLuwYqU8rvOYle4MxQ.text: I attempted to go to M&T during the opening and turned away because I had on sneakers (which is fine since that was the dress code). A month later attempted with slacks and shoes and was told I couldn't go up (after waiting 35 min on a line) because I had on a sweater and not a collared shirt even though it was the middle of December. I told myself that I wouldn't go back but 2 weeks ago after a wedding I was invited so I went. Surely, I was good to go since I had on a suit. The line was 45 min long and had about 20 people on it which is ridiculous. I saw a buddy of my walk straight up to the bouncer with two women and had a small conversation and was let up in 5 min. I asked and the bouncer said they stayed at the hotel, not knowing that I knew the guy. Once upstairs my buddy said he wasn't staying there that the bouncer knew one of the ladies so he let them up!!! There was also a guy on line with a hooded sweater and Gucci sneakers on so in my head I knew he wouldn't get upstairs. About 15 mins after I got up I saw the guy at the bar!!! WTF if you are going to attempt to have a dress code and make people wait at least an hour to get upstairs be consistent. We got a table and ordered food and the waitress came back after taking our order and said they just closed the kitchen less than 5 min ago so they couldn't accommodate our order. The only thing that was good was the view and the cool bartender Henry that made bad ass drinks. Third times a charm and they failed. I won't be back!!!

8gZd3Os-OUsueovVi8MoeA.text: Nice location, great views and good atmosphere. Very pretentious however everything does not match the upscale atmosphere they are going for. Hostesses and servers wear sneakers, softsoap hand soap in restrooms, no toilet paper etc. Also if you're there with a big group. Order separately at the bar and not at the table with the group as they cannot effectively split checks. I went after work on a Monday so it wasn't that busy. May try a weekend to enjoy a bigger crowd and hopefully the music.

Ii860nxVY4X5FykL2_fMqw.text: The best of the best! You can't beat the view... the venue is gorgeous! Upscale yet relaxed and the food is AMAZING. Try the mushrooms and the pig ears, to die for. The staff was so friendly and welcoming, I will be a regular.

yYCTFtVVk38Y-SJA97FSRQ.text: Great view, great vibes, and great atmosphere! Unpopular opinion: I like that they have a dress code! Went on a Friday evening around 8pm and there was a line, The wait wasn't too bad though. I had the French Martini and crab cake and both were tasty. I'm planning on coming back with my girls !

iZAB1FgOFgR0oTPU2qNkTA.text: I came here on a date, definitely set the bar high. Date did wear a cap and they respectfully asked him to remove it. No biggie! The fish tacos were delicious and our drinks even better! Date did not like his old fashion and the waitress made him something else without a fuss! Definitely coming back!

F3xJIwuvTcdZNa-Y-MQrpA.text: Just what Charlotte was missing! Went here on a Saturday night and was met with a line that took about 20 mins to get through to get up the elevator to the bar. It was well worth it. Nice music and atmosphere was wonderful. Variety of seating options, although it was unclear if the tables are reserved or first come first serve? You can see right into the baseball stadium and watch the home game fireworks! The crowd was 30s+ and on the older side which was nice. It was certainly loud with a DJ, but everyone was fairly in control and respectful. Will be back!

d0LrwXSwZL1c83mtxVdWBw.text: Pros: they have a very nice view and the ambiance is pretty cool. Kind of something that you would find on the west coast. Cocktails are really good. And the bartenders are super friendly and wants to make sure you're taken care of. The elevator that will take you up to the lounge is pretty amazing.   Cons: The crowd that can be found there can be very pretentious and their going to block the bar off just to chat with their friends so prepare to speak up cut through them. Food was pricey and definitely not worth the cost.   Overall: I go there when I feel like dressing up to enjoy a cocktail and people watch. Service is good there and so are their cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

TuOcR38mcRS4uw1HAfHCcQ.text: This place provides beautiful views a thousand times over... perfect for pictures! If you're visiting and see a line under the Merchant & Trade don't worry, it goes semi-fast. However, I believe the method of getting people upstairs could be improved, as the number of groups going up at once wasn't based on an actual count and the actual indoor space doesn't provide much standing room, so capacity may become an issue as it gets warmer. Also, dress code is enforced so athletic outfits, shoes and baseball caps will more than likely get you turned around.   Nonetheless, the ambiance was beautiful and rewarding after a long day. The tables are reserved for those that actually request them, so be sure to check with the hostess if you would like to get a table. After getting to the bar, the bartender was friendly and let me know that I would taken care of shortly. I ordered an Apple Eclipse($14) and it was good and came with a kick. But I will say, be mindful of keeping a tab open or ordering multiple drinks. Two drinks cost $30, without food.  Overall, I look forward to visiting this place again for another girls night out! Hope to see my fellow Yelp people there!

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

08Qiv62C7ReRzvDM4P5EqA.text: Swanky rooftop bar atmosphere. The view is neat; you oversee the baseball field which would be cool for a night on which they have fireworks. Drinks were tasty and expensive. I will say I was thoroughly impressed with how chilled my cocktail was. It feels funny to even write this but it really stood out to me! We also ordered their trio of ice cream/sorbets which was fantastic. I agree with other posters that there was a mixed crowd of people on a weeknight, the dress code is enforced and there's no shade so if it's midday you will be roasting.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ice cream/sorbet trio. Banana, raspberry and passion fruit.

rrRR2EE1OUQC6dmeFRbexw.text: Most recently I came to M & T for drinks with girl friends after dinner. Fortunately, when we arrived there was only a very short line. We were a group of 7 and they split us into 2 groups to get on the elevator - which was a little weird, but ultimately not a big deal.   When you walk out of the elevator, you land in a lobby area and have to walk through a door way into the restaurant/bar/lounge.   I love all the light that filters through the very posh space. The space is rectangle shaped so not very deep, but elongated. There was a very large bar towards the back, bench seating along the wall and lounge spaces and tables throughout.   The real reason people come to M & T is for the view! They have a great outdoor space that expands along the entire space. There are high top tables, lounge sofas and chairs ... and many opportunities to selfie... believe me, I saw about 15 girls taking selfies every 5 minutes.   It's a mixed crowd here, young and old. We saw a table of bloggers and parents out to date night. We were there at like 9pm so it was still early.   The drinks were great! I order the same drink everywhere I go (Tito's + soda + lots of lime) sometimes where I ask for lots of lime the bartender doesn't really get the memo - so I have to ask for more. The sweet bartender mentioned she drinks it the same way and made sure I had plenty before handing me my cocktail. One of my girl friends ordered the beat it - it was actually fantastic. Made with Deep Eddy's and Lenny Boy Elite Beet kamboucha. It tasted like the kamboucha but with a little kick.   Living in NYC for some time ... this place is one of the few places that totally reminds me of the city.

jDRBE4w29amb_nR8Qk47Qw.text: I'm giving this a 3 because of how long it took for our waitress to initially come to our table and do follow up check ins. At one point I had to grab another waitress to assist us. It's a chic place to grab drinks. The outdoor patio was a bit crowded, but that's to be expected when the weather is nice. The drinks were average, nothing too spectacular. This would be a place to visit during the week for drinks to avoid crowds.

fddNWTjoKT8a5Bj6oGSbZA.text: It's unfortunate that we didn't make it past the door. This place was scouted earlier in the day for a 30 person business cocktail hour. We had only planned for 2 hrs from 6-8 and one check. A business meeting paid for by our company but we were turned away and denied access because the person that was going to treat was wearing the wrong shoe. Granite, a few of us had on the wrong shoes but business from 30 people for 2 hours you would think they would let it slide.

88m6aYjMQBVKYe2A_6gMRQ.text: Heard so much about this place that decided to go with group of friends on 5/4 . It was group of 12 . Earlier during the afternoon I had called up to make reservations and we were told that it's first come basis. Reached the place ... the first entrance looks if you are in proper attire ( no shorts or flip flops ) and then another person checks your ID and 3rd person then escorts you to elevator. We were good till now . Once we reached the Restaurant we asked if we could get reservations and were told that it was a wait if 1 hr . We got our name on waiting list hoping that we would have a table by 900 pm . As we started moving around the place I found empty tables with sign " Gorgeous.. I am taken" . On enquiring I found that these were reserved ... reserved for whom ... we were told that it was first come first serve basis. On talking with resturant folks they said they take reservations for 5 or more ..well we were 12 ....and what was issue .  Anyway we were given a temporary table till 9:00 and then we had to figure out. So I went in front to find as where I was in waitlist .. found out that our name was removed because we were given a temporary table ..at this point we had enough ..paid for our drinks ...and then moved to Essex.  Good part of this place is Great city view from top.

CBYjVD9YTzRd4TiL1GDpCA.text: My husband and I stumbled upon the entrance to Merchant & Trade last night while walking around Uptown.   When you walk in, you are immediately escorted to an elevator that is a straight ride to the top. When we got up there, we went to the bar for a drink. The inside space is super open with glass windows all around. My husband and I both settled on the M&T Old Fashion. Very delish and well made! The drink menu had a handful of fun cocktails, beer, and wine.  I noticed that alot of tables outside had a reserved sign. Since we were only going to be there for 20 minutes as we had tickets for a show, I asked the hostess if we could sit at one. She quickly and sweetly showed me which table we could grab for a bit.   Impressive is the first word that comes to mind when walking outside. Loads of beautiful couches, tables, chairs, and fire pits overlooking a great view of Uptown!!! The ambiance was relaxing but with a classy twist.  We didnt try any food or look at the food menu so I cannot comment on that. Next time we go, we will grab a small bite with our drinks and I'll update the review.  Nice job M&T and welcome to Uptown!

0BjSO5Y5a2lIKE2Ft8IMRA.text: Love atmosphere, food and drink. The vibe is always great and the view is spectacular. Wish I would have took pics.

HtkS6b44wHva-KNZnoKj1A.text: This place is my favorite place in all of Charlotte (bar wise)  The wait staff, the bartenders, and the management are all top notch!! Th drinks are crafted so well and the food is outstanding!! Oh, and did I mention the incredible view from the rooftop for sunset?  go check out merchant next time you're in town, it's a part of the Tryon Park Hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

HQmuk522xVJ_SuQUlXTPHA.text: I never reviewed after the first time we visited Merchant & Trade, so we have been twice now...  We don't like waiting in lines, and were lucky on this Saturday afternoon to go right in. They are pretty sticklers with the dress code, so be sure to call before going and check your attire our you might get turned away.  I am so surprised to see *at time of writing this* just 3 stars for M&T. This venue is elevated, upscale, and as many have mentioned before, serve great cocktails with an amazing view.  I haven't experienced slow service here.  One particular welcomed feature of Merchant & Trade is that they don't serve $15 cocktails in a plastic glass because you're on a roof. Instead you are handed a crystal-like actual glass to enjoy your adult beverage. I'm over the age of being on a rooftop to drink bubbles out of a plastic flute. Please. Even at the W in DC overlooking the White House. No thanks.

2RXK7mDeHUujFWM48JwI7Q.text: Discriminatory dress code. They say sneakers are allowed pending they are high end and clean and compliment the outfit, but high end Jordans do not fit their definition meanwhile they let people in with sweatshirts. Of course leaving it this way so they can easily discreminate at their discretion. It was 7pm on a rainy Friday, and we were meeting out of town guests. This is the exact place I hope Charlotte does not become. We will not be returning.

qmFmZqMBucABV6a5p7K-Ig.text: The vibes and the views are better than most places uptown that tout vibes and views  The food is tasty. Comes in small plate form and can easily be shared with friends. It's a standing room kinda bar, but it's comfortable at the same time. A Charlotte sunset paired with a whiskey on the rocks (for him) and a Malbec (for me) is the perfect start to an evening or date night.   Keep the dress code in mind don't show up in jeans or sneakers. This place has quality standards and it shows!!

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Swanky after work vibes! Come here for the sunset, then stay!

hb8I3izDs70QD2swJMNa-g.text: The only great thing about this place was the view.  The music was pretty bad... I'm really open minded, but this felt more like RAVE venue than a upscale bar. The vibe was not what I was expecting.   My group ordered super simple drinks, mostly bottled beer. It took at least 20 minutes for them to arrive

57LJwerzZ0SEPRMQDO6V-g.text: Stayed at the Kimpton for the weekend, so the SO and I decided to check out M&T for drinks before dinner on a Saturday. This was the Saturday before Christmas. The whole city of Charlotte was pretty quiet and empty. We noticed a line late Friday night. I think the staff at the hotel informed us that Kimpton customers go through a different line. Not 100% sure, but when we arrived around 7pm there was no line whatsoever. The doormen greeted us and directed us to the elevator.  We did not experience any issues with the dress code. We looked up M&T prior to going and read about the dress code. We also checked with the front desk to make sure jeans were allowed. They informed us that "nice" jeans (meaning no logos, rips, etc) were fine. I wore a dress and booties and my SO wore "nice" jeans, a dress shirt, jacket, and dress shoes.   Located on the 19th floor of the hotel, M&T has an amazing view of Charlotte. We did not stay long because we had dinner reservations for 8:30 elsewhere. We stayed for a few drinks and enough time to take in the view. The doormen, hostesses, bartenders and the rest of the staff were all enthusiastic and helpful from start to finish. All were happy to take our picture for us... which should be expected if you work at a rooftop bar. Lol. We enjoyed the drinks and outdoor seating areas. The drinks cost a little bit more than your average bar, but nothing outrageous. We look forward to returning and trying their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. View
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lounge area

2vjjWSg2tgjkFOY2fWcIJA.text: We heard about this place for a while so we came to check it out with some friends. FYI:: Be mindful of their dress code, read about it on their website!!!  We ordered drinks and an appetizer. The French Martini was a hit! We ordered a couple of those in addition to the Blue Crab rolls.... they were good! The ambiance was chic and it was a great view of the city. You can see directly inside the baseball stadium and Romeare(sp) Park. There actually happened to be a baseball game going on while we were there and The Charlotte Knights (I think that's our baseball team's name lol) won, therefore we got a chance to see the fireworks (apparently whether we lose or not they still put on a fireworks display--- pretty cool). Oh and despite the long line we stood in to get in, overall we had a great time!  Lastly, I want to point out that the main reason I rated this experience a 5 is the service I received right from the beginning. As we were standing in line, I had to run to the ladies room, so I entered the hotel entry and was pleasantly greeted by some amazing individuals at the front desk: Tommie/Tommy and Dexter. Oh my goodness, when I tell you their spirit, their customer service, and their Amazing attitude was on 1,000.... all I can say is that I'll be back to this hotel to not only see them - Ha! But to stay a night and enjoy the rooftop. Customer service is hard to come by and it was so natural for them! Thanks fellas ---- you rock! Y'all need to be managers!!!! Y'all are much appreciated!

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Martini! So good!

mqMOkUXNzl7VIB80jPf19g.text: The dress code is absolutely discriminatory. I was wearing business professional clothing, but had on a pair of brand new Nike tennis shoes. I was told that because the Nike swoosh was visible, I am not allowed upstairs. I explained to them that I am meeting my parents upstairs, who are staying in the Kimpton Hotel. They did not care, and were extremely unprofessional to me and my girlfriend.  While waiting for my parents to finish their drinks and come down, I noticed people in Adidas, Converse, and other brands of tennis shoes allowed upstairs. I pointed this out to the staff, but they completely ignored me.  This discriminatory philosophy is dangerous to the company. If this continues in the manner that it was handled, a lawsuit will no doubt arise.

u6_ijajRTAH2ahHGIlZiKw.text: Very cool spot, security/door guys were very cool about being honest about wait times and getting people in! Line moves fast! Was worth the 15 minutes wait! Hostesses were nice server was very sweet l, drinks and food were great, more lounge inside on one side and more party on other side, great views great music great service, very cool space! Can't wait to go again!

QlEoUdeluiLPBmvowg7BbQ.text: I would come here again for the view and that was basically all I had the chance to experience. We arrived at 5pm with plans to meet friends for drinks before dinner. Our friend wasn't allowed in because of the dress code (he was wearing sneakers) so we quickly chugged our drinks and left. Make sure you look up and follow the dress code so this doesn't happen to you!

AtgEXAbuRDNYbpVzDSisXg.text: Came to Merchant and Trade with some friends and had a great time.  This is a great place to grab some drinks and enjoy a beautiful view.  Service was good and the drinks flow well.    We stayed inside because it was a little cold and look for ward to visiting again on a warm day.

ZLgAkw1ABIGnpQQgI3GPag.text: Ugh. I so badly want to love Merchant & Trade. I have been a handful of times now for drinks and visited again last night with two girlfriends for drinks and appetizers. When the weather is nice outside like it has been lately, it's tough to find a better place in Charlotte to grab a drink outside. The views really are gorgeous and they did a very nice job with the design of both the inside and outside. It has a very upscale lounge vibe and keep in mind that the dress code is strictly enforced. Also be prepared for lines to get in if you are going during peak hours.   The service yesterday was not good at all. To me, It appears that they are very understaffed. Our waitress was really kind but she didn't have the time to do check backs (drinks also took forever) or refill our waters, etc. We waited with empty water and drink glasses for a very long time. With that being said, our margaritas were delicious and I was pleased to hear that they don't use sweet and sour mix (only lime juice and club soda).   The real disappointment of our visit yesterday was our meat and cheese board (see photo attached). They charge $12/person for any meat and cheese board order, which in theory I think is great. Unfortunately, ours came out and it was TINY. There were three of us and no way was it $36 worth of food...like 10 nuts total, very small portions of three cheeses and about 5 crackers in total. Big big bummer. I asked the waitress right away if it was right for three people and she said she would ask the kitchen but never got back to us. It wasn't even worth disputing at time of payment because it had already taken a long time to get our checks.   Overall, gorgeous space but I would expect excellent service given the high prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margarita
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. $36 cheese board...they charge $12/person and the size was extremely disappointing
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

ivIuHJB8CprB3iVWg_kbSw.text: Wow! I am shocked at the reviews and low rating. Tonight was my first time here and I love it. Everything from walking in to riding straight up the elevator with no stops. The staff were friendly and the views of the city are amazing! They have a very electic menu and a good amount of cocktails to choose from. I ordered the pimento cheese sandwich and loved it. The malbec was also very flavorful. We will definitely be back.   Also it was not crowded. We were able to sit any where and did not have an issue with service or the dress code.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pimento cheese sandwich. It was amazing

S4OsfsQWX3K7mSYRGqOZ-A.text: Merchant and Trade (located in/on top/entrance next to) the Kimpton Hotel in Uptown Charlotte is probably one of, if not the bougiest rooftop/bars in all of Uptown.  There is some what of a "dress code" so I wouldn't come here in sweats.  There is an outdoor area for nice weather as well as a large inside area when its cold or rainy.  I've been here a couple times now and have had decent experiences both times.  The last time around, we had a waitress that didn't really seem to know her drinks very well, but all good.  What people come here for is really the ambience - great for dates, after parties, work gatherings, etc.  The crowd is low key and usually professional from what I've encountered.  Drinks are decently priced and are on average for a swanky bar.  Their cocktails are also pretty tasty, specifically the Typhoon, which is made with mezcal if that is your thing.    I haven't really had the food here since I've only been past 11pm, but the cake pops were pretty good as a dessert.  Great alternative to the "meh" bar scene in Uptown, especially if you are a traveler like me.

AfMPweKLWmqg_LtEJ9orgA.text: If you are looking for a place where you can get dressed up, have a great view of the city, and enjoy well made cocktails, then put this spot on your list!  Note that they have a dress code so leave those sweatpants at home! Upon arriving, we were shown to a beautiful elevator plated in mirrors. A short while later, we emerged on the rooftop lounge where were we greeted by a friendly hostess and seated. The lawn furniture was comfortable with a classy twist. We also had a great view of the city since we were seated by the edge.  The drink menu was straightforward and on the higher end (~$15 a cocktail). When we arrived at 7:30p on a Monday, we were informed that they had ran out of some ingredients which limited our choices.   I ordered the Mai Tai after my first choice was unavailable. It took a little while for the drinks to arrive but nothing too concerning. The drink was tasty, but at the price tag, I stopped at one.  Overall a good spot if you want to feel fancy but prepare to lighten your wallet a little. That being said, I could see it as an excellent post-work hang out!

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

4c6rsCf3vpkkqmG8avTLWg.text: I was really excited about going to this place because the entrance looks very cute and when we entered, the area looked very upscale as well. Unfortunately the food was very disappointing and the service was pretty horrible. My friend's steak was over done and the center of my lamb meatballs was also cold. The bill cannot be split more than three ways and the servers intentionally avoided us multiple times. The drinks however, were surprisingly good and the view was also pretty decent at the patio. Overall I would recommend that you go there for drinks and for a place to hang out but don't go there if you are expecting to have a good meal. The food is not worth the price.

oU8emyrs29wGKcdpA5jkMw.text: First of all it is 90 plus degrees outside and it is the same temperature inside of Merchant and Trade. Absolutely ridiculous for a restaurant with multiple air vents.   Two, the seating rules are silly. The hostess told us to sit anywhere in the bar and someone will serve you. However the waitress said we have to ASK the hostess to get someone to serve us. When I go to the hostess she doesn't ask what we want to do, dine in or drink, she just says if you want a drink you can't sit where you are. Starts another explanation and I just walked away as I don't have time.   Third. I just can't get over how effin hot it is in here. My entire being is on pure fire.   Other things to note. The bathrooms are clean and the view is nice.

fZ_PT4QRwsand8ta7wOKtQ.text: This is one of the many rooftop restaurants overlooking the city. The establishment has its own dedicated entrance that reminds me of some sort of exclusive Las Vegas night club. They have a large outdoor patio area that has sliding glass doors to close the indoor portion off if needed. This place is trendy and has a dress code. We had the sliders, the blue crab rolls, and the tacos. The sliders were next level, but they are quite pricey 3 for $15. They are pretty small as well. This is a cool spot just know that it comes with a price.

dpLbktFQ8JSRoiNry2UdEg.text: This is my go to for drinks, good vibe, nice scenery, great ambiance! Sit outside around the fire pit or hang out outside during the summer with a cool beverage! vzPx3lDZb96DKv5AgnIUbQ.text: This was a fun stop on our girls' night tour. The real highlight of this place were the bartenders. They really know their stuff! They created unique cocktails for our group based on our tastes and it was so much fun! The downside is that it's pretty pricey, so more of a one or two drink stop for my crew. The particular night we went, they had also shut down 3/4 of the bar for a private event that never seemed to happen. It was sort of odd, but the bar staff were attentive nevertheless.

IKxe4WnpDaBnN4ywCgIzQw.text: Great views, especially at night.  When you sit at a table along the glass you get a very peaceful view. Off in the distance you can see the planes methodically landing at CLT, and closer you get a great view of the park and if you time it right, the Knights stadium.  The drinks are good and they are about as pricey expected for a place like this, but this is a great place to check out and relax at on a nice night.  The servers were very nice and accommodating as well.  The only downside is this place seems to be very popular, and with the hotel crowd, it seems to get crowded quick.  If you are looking for a relaxing time, I would recommend heading there on a week night.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Catching a game while enjoying some cocktails

LiDEf7gQC0YfI659KkzH_A.text: The waitress was chipper but sat us down and forgot about us. We sat in the covered patio and it smelled like rotten eggs. Our drinks were simple, vodka water and a dirty martini. The olives were rotten and the martini tasted horrible. The vodka water came with one stale lemon. Over priced drinks but a nice view.  UPDATE to prior review: I was invited back for a "do over" by the manager who replied to my earlier post. I came back and had reserved seating, the drinks were 10x better, and the appetizers were delicious. Our waitress was as sweet as pie and very attentive. I have been to this bar At least 5-7 times and I hope my future experience is as good as this one. Thank you Merchant & Trade for doing right by your customer!

WixhvPL039VVuN18h8tqjg.text: A fave start to a night out takes me to M&T. Great music, great vibes! It's so modern and posh with lots of space and fantastic views of city. Ask for Henry (bartender). He makes the BEST cocktails ever. Try the HellCat... it's my go to.

uBT9lDwlW17_jizvRgfhqw.text: I can here with a big group on a Thursday night. Once we got inside they were happy to accommodate our large group and they directed us to an outdoor area that could fit ~30.   The service was so so slow, which I would have understood if they were swamped or if we all had our own tabs, however we were all on 1 tab and the bar was only half full. They gave us 1 server for our huge group, and this was not sufficient at all. Our server worked hard and did the best she could. However they lost a lot of possible sales to us because we couldn't order as many drinks as we wanted with just the 1 server (and yes we asked for more servers, but they could help us).  Even after we got drink orders in, it took more than 30 minutes for them to come out. We also ordered a few apps and they were average at best. The fried mushrooms were soggy and lacked flavor. The duck steak buns were mehhh. The lobster corn dogs were cold.   Overall, the view is great. Come for the view, pictures, and 1 overpriced drink.

b5hXw7COYWcRXJeLcqvFRg.text: Bouncers are bullies. They treat this rooftop bar like a nightclub.  Don't bother. Plenty of other rooftop bars in the area.

AEtgeymDsH4DF3bFFpVbww.text: I really like this space.   Of course it's new and hip but the decor is very nice and they have a fabulous patio!  Plenty of seating, a retractable cover, great views, good drinks and really good appetizers!  I'm craving the tater tots again.    They have a dress code so don't schlep in with flip flops and expect to get in.  You are vetted before you can even go up the elevator.  The service is top-notch & professional.  I especially like Aislinn, the hostess/manager.  She is very good at making you feel welcome and taken care of.  Seating is reserved so check in or call ahead.

yB_384SDLddlO_x7WHE8FA.text: Ambiance on 100! The views are stunning and this place just exudes sexy. For food there are more tapas and light fare options than traditional entrees and though they all look AMAZING but there just aren't enough of them.   I was only here for a cocktail so I can't wait to come back and try the food. There are only 7 cocktails on the menu and they're all as eclectic as the food. I ordered the cyclone and though it was very tasty, for it to be the most expensive item on the cocktail menu at $16, it was a bit too small for my liking.  I was here by myself because I was just killing time however this is a great place for a group of friends to come and hang out. I'm excited for my next time here.

ZV9tOZ460xUv8BE9OqxFvg.text: I have met friends here more than once. It's a great vibe.  Beautiful views. Great atmosphere. Delicious food.  Great wine and cocktails. The service is also very good.   It's worth the drive or Uber

PHynokBi5ygkxqa8QIS09A.text: I went to happy hour here on a Tuesday night. It was just okay for me. We heard there was a dress code, but coming from work, none of us had issues. There's an entrance on Third Street and an elevator that will take you to the rooftop. We were seated right away and chose to stay inside since it was so hot outside. Even though we were inside, it was still hot.   The menu has small plates but they are big enough for a meal. I had the mahi tacos and a coconut something mocktail. There were three tacos. The fish was flakey and well-seasoned. The slaw was okay. I wish there was a slight sweetness to it. But the Chipotle sauce was good. The mocktail was good. Not too sweet and had a kick of basil or something.   Service was good when we first got there. But it was very slow to get food, drinks and our bill. While service was friendly, it was way too slow for a Tuesday night.  After we did go outside to look at the views and we would like to enjoy them when it's cooler outside.

dHjKfsCLPgkO6gL3nVup6g.text: While I have visited many times, my first impression not being the greatest, you can't deny that their patio area is beautiful. The line at the door (and sometimes wrapped around outside) can be a bit of a pain. Once you are upstairs, make sure to try their cocktail specials. I personally prefer the happy hour during the week. I am hesitant to return for the late night weekend vibe.   Just last week (July 2019) I had a great happy hour experience.  Everyone was very friendly from the gent that let me up, to the staff when I walked in, to my server. My server was quick to let me know that there were a few drink specials that weren't on the menu and I am SO glad she did! I had a pina colada inspired drink that was not only delicious but it was absolutely beautiful. I drank it way too fast and thought it was best to eat a little something before I continued drinking. I ordered the calamari and it was delicious. I also ended up ordering the meat and cheese board which did not disappoint.   I am so glad I made a very spur of the moment decision to go in again because it drew me to refer my friends to return on another occasion soon.

Vqyo4AjMPeLPxUC2AGuRBw.text: If you're from a major city visiting boring Charlotte; then this is the place for you to go!   Full disclosure; there is an unnecessary line out the door due to "bouncers" only letting 3-5 people in the elevator at a time to go up to the roof.   The atmosphere is amazing and they obviously have a great view of the city. The drinks weren't that strong but we had a great time people watching. The food however was horrible. We had the lamb meatballs which were DRY! The fish tacos were bland and the order of fries came with 6 fries.  This place is more of a come enjoy the atmosphere kind of night. I have no intentions on returning to Charlotte anytime soon so It's not likely they I will be returning to M&T.

ltzZJ0MSBNI38JcM9Uy3cw.text: Met some friends here for drinks while I was in Charlotte on business. This place is on roof of a building. So, the view is great and the service was excellent. There was a private party outside, so we couldn't go out. But, looked like it would be fun to sit outside and look at the view from there. We ordered The Velvet Slipper drink and it was pretty and tasty. We also ordered the lobster goyza and it was really good.

UfFFIU2d0rWBQ6mR3E6HyA.text: Yes this place is pricey but you're paying for the view and experience! Not just the food/drinks. I'm rating this place solely on the drinks as we did not eat.  We got the hell cat (awesome Black Sea salt rim) and then I didn't see anything immediately jump out at me on the menu so I chatted with Michael the bartender who asked a few of my preferences and then went to work making me a custom drink. I absolutely LOVE when bartenders do this and even more so when the drink is a 10/10 as this one was. Ask for a St. Michael if he's working and you won't be disappointed.

We had to chug our drinks so we could meet him. I would make sure everyone is dressed appropriately and have nice shoes (sneakers are not allowed.)
