KpvGddjJz_ouDHQR3F4PmA.text: Since this was my 2nd time visiting M&T, 5 stars is a long shot. I would give it 4.5 stars, but unfortunately that's not an option.  I visited this rooftop again with my bf and 2 friends the 1st Friday in October. The weather was beautiful, and we arrived at 4:30 pm on the dot. My bf and I wanted to sit outside, but since they were still getting everything set up, we decided to wait inside and order a drink at the inside bar.   I ordered the 'Golden Wolf' and my bf ordered a regular Mojito. I NEED TO ADDRESS THIS ASAP - Justin (who we found out later was the bar back) made our mojito, and it was the BEST tasting mojito I've had since I visited Cabo, Mexico last July. After we had sat outside, I wanted another mojito, and requested our waitress to find him and get it made by him. However, he was nowhere to be found since he wasn't an actual bartender, and it was super disappointing. I settled for someone else to make it, and while it was still good, I could definitely taste the difference. As for the Golden Wolf, the drink was prosecco based but definitely delicious. If I could replace drinking this over mimosas for the rest of my life, I definitely would! We also ordered a side of fries that were pretty expensive - had maybe 15 fries in the bowl (not worth it).   Highly suggest visiting this rooftop in the daytime. I haven't been here at night, but our friends enjoyed the daytime view so much more. And I'm all for day drinking over night drinking anyways! Since this is by far my fave rooftop in the Charlotte (reminds me of home - nyc), I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mojito - made by Justin the barback aka THE BEST MOJITO I&#39;ve had in forever   The golden wolf - prosecco based but super tasty

F_phd9kRbW1hdm1MPq_vJA.text: We came here Saturday night to celebrate my new job.   I'm not sure where to begin with my review. I knew it was rooftop and there was an inside/outside option but when we arrived, I felt as if I was already outside. It was a humid night so the next time I come here I'll be sure that it isn't. We arrived early in the evening to avoid having to wait in a line. While waiting for our table we grabbed a couple of drinks at the bar. Two drinks were $35. Our wait for a table wasn't long. We opted to sit outside hoping we'd catch a slight breeze on such a humid night.  I have to say that the outside area was very nice. The overall vibe of this place was so cool, although my thighs were sweating. ANYWAY...we ordered more drinks and a few of the tapas items. By far my favorite was the pimento grilled cheese and I also loved the crab rolls.  I definitely see myself coming back here for more celebratory drinks.  Oh! I don't know how I could've forgotten to mention the heated toilet seats! I only had two drinks, or else I'd likely think that it was just me, but I'm almost certain that toilet seat was very warm and inviting! Lol The women's powder room was actually very nice.

ZfnJWymuIU6WMZa9ss_T_A.text: Decided to give it a try after hearing great things about the ambiance and view. Visited a couple of hours after the Panthers game, on a late Sunday afternoon, so luckily they let us up the elevator in our Panther attire, otherwise I hear there is a strict dress code later in the evening. The view was pretty great, so we sat outside.  Ordered the Blackened Mahi Tacos and the Grilled Peach Salad: both items were outstanding!!! SO outstanding in fact, my friend ordered ANOTHER Grilled Peach salad to go, for lunch the next day!  I will be back for the view AND food!

accCx2SkPozr482oK67whg.text: I was visiting my sister in North Carolina, and we went downtown in Charlotte where my nephew lives.  Him and his wife took us to this super cool rooftop bar that had the best view of the city!  We had drinks and listened to the live music they had playing and then got a table outside where we got to watch the fireworks display from the baseball field across the street after the game ended. It was such a great atmosphere to hang with friends and enjoy the beautiful weather!  I Highly recommend this place if you're in the downtown Charlotte area!  Check it out.

yD0CZTyiEqHyDqHJdWvE4Q.text: Yes yes yes!!!! Came here for my birthday had a wonderful time on the rooftop.  Tip get here early. Charlotte has plenty of casual spots to enjoy. But if you're wanting to enjoy a little dressy date night out, this is a good place to start or end the night

DRLw2fMnXAjbx0HFlqdmCA.text: Incredibly rude and pretentious bouncer at the entrance/elevator. I do not normally leave reviews but this is an exception. I am a tourist to Charlotte and was treated very inferior because my brother had on (very nice) sneakers and shorts (it's warm this weekend!!). I was not aware Charlotte was so serious about attire to enter hotel bars....

iOzZbdtEY0Q0pxjkRSflMw.text: Overpriced, but my cocktail wasn't that bad. The novelty of a rooftop bar overlooking the Knight's Stadium is what you are paying for.

xvvwLev32so6u0rygIp7vA.text: Atmosphere and location are great but hard to overcome poor service and cocktails.  We stopped in for a drink before dinner and took us over 25 minutes to revive our drinks after ordering (drinks were simple - dirty martini, Manhattan, bourbon in the rocks, etc.). The drinks were watered down and appeared to have sat at the bar while ice melted.  One of our friends cut their lip on a broken glass.  The server took care of changing their drink, but took another 15 minutes to get her replacement.  No manager stopped by to ensure she was okay.  Will not be returning due to high prices and poor service.

RN8gtmO7bI1_HYzxNDiYSQ.text: Too pretentious to take my money on a Wednesday night when I'm wearing casual shoes on a rainy night. I've lived in many cities that would expect this, but not Charlotte. No need to spend my money here.

PqdbM0Z_Ev1ikRsB1Vfttw.text: Brandon the bouncer was awesome! He knew a table wouldn't be taken up for about two hours and seeing my friends and I be without a table prompted him to ask the hostess to let us sit at the reserved table for about an hour and a half! Will definitely recommend because he thought quickly in his feet! Thanks so much Brandon! You're the man!

nGY_ftrlOO0qDb_qW-WFew.text: Have tried to show my friends this bar several times but have been impeded by long lines. Was excited to show them to the bar this weekend when the line was short. Was rudely turned away at the door for wearing tennis shoes. I make enough to spend my money on a nice cocktail. Will never be back. Thanks for changing my mind.

HAjpkRBtuOgBJLqneWTPUw.text: Stay away, there are better places than this place.  Waited outside for 45 minutes and finally got up and the place was empty. Drinks were average dive bar taste with NYC prices. Spend your money else where. This is Charlotte.  He attitude of the staff sucked and went across the street to Ink N Ivey and had a blast.  Much better places to hang in Charlotte.

oXH-HEpBWZxjnmBN8Du5ug.text: Omg! Rip and rave about this place! It's amazing the view and ambience is a 10/10 it was packed yet my service was still on point!! Food and drinks were also superb , a little pricey but worth it. Food also came out super fast considering how busy they were. Great crowd of people as well. Very impressed, I'll definitely be back.

QltFABgKA-0q8BdvdMV3UQ.text: The atmosphere is laid back and nice. The view alone is worth a visit. I definitely recommend for a birthday, girl's night out or date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States

s1VRoM3Pv7zfx1tspX7Q5g.text: Took my uncle and his wife here last Friday night for drinks after having dinner downstairs at Angeline's. The drinks were watered down and the service could of been a lot better. A lot of my friends referred this place to me but l don't  think I will be returning back. The DJ also didn't play a mixed of music just mainly house music but the host was very friendly and the rooftop is nice.

tNWptFNob1N1Bwgq2Czmyw.text: I would recommend going anywhere else in Charlotte besides here. Local McDonald's have better food, there are places with better views that aren't as pretentious or overpriced.

QMzbXCxXBYLgQcWF09uogA.text: Great view. Drinks and food were ok, overpriced. We were in a large group and they could not split our bill. Sent us to the ATM and that wasn't working either. When it's nice out I would still recommend going for the view and atmosphere.

jAUfYwpFhI5zOw402__-mQ.text: Gorgeous views. Fancy cocktail menu. I have never eaten here so can't speak to that, to be honest I haven't seen any plates of food coming out any time I've been here. More of a place to grab a drink. The vibe they go for is very high end which has pros and cons. I see many reviews with complaints of inconsistency of the enforcement of the dress code and I agree with those. They at times enforce a strict sneaker rule and then other times I have seen people in there with sneakers on? They may want to figure that out so people aren't confused and/or angry. Also it seems that lots of seating says "reserved" yet you can be there for over an hour without seeing anyone sit there. Overall it's a nice place to go if you want to get outside and see the city but we sometimes can't go due to someone in your group perhaps not being the right footwear.

W8nQxjNCgOIaa1DKHaJJVA.text: My boyfriend and I are new to the Charlotte area and decided to take my Aunt who was visiting to the rooftop bar we had heard so much about (both good & bad). We were seated promptly and the server (I do not have her name) was extremely pleasant and provided recommendations on her favorite dishes & drinks. We each had two drinks over an hour and half. At the couch next to us was three of our coworkers who we later joined after we finished eating and paid our bill. That's when our evening took a turn for the worse. We joined our coworkers where a hostess or cocktail waitress came over immediately saying the table was reserved even though our friends had been occupying the couch for over an hour. She put a sign down on the table and said nothing else nor would answer our questions. Another waitress named Gabby was helping the other party at the other end of the couch and I politely asked her if we could order drinks and she rolled her eyes and walked away which I was in utter shock for the lack of professionalism. When she came back to serve the other part of the couch, I asked again and she took our order very annoyed. When Gabby returned, she told us she could not serve us and we would have to order food first. I was beside myself because it seemed like they just did not want us there since it was apparent from the first second we sat down we were not welcomed by the staff. We were served two drinks in over a three hour period, had already ate, and now were being told we could no longer be served. I was so embarrassed and insulted- I never have been treated with such disrespect before. My aunt treated us to dinner that night and it was a big night out for her.  I felt awful that our experience  did a complete 180 and her night out was ruined. I do not know if it was because my boyfriend was the only guy, if it was my aunts age or what, but something doesn't add up and cutting us off from being served sober seemed to be their answer. I asked to speak to a manager and all he could say was "I'm sorry" and there there was lack of interest to make things right - it was very apparent he did not care. I always held Kimpton hotels to a high standard and had great experiences, but I would not recommend Merchant & Trade to anyone especially when you are entertaining out of town guests. When I told friends about the experience, they were not surprised as they had their own personal experiences of how they were treated by the staff. The staff and management are arrogant and their behavior does not align with the upscale lounge experience that they promote. Disappointed in the Kimpton brand.

9vLhTDeVbvkivXdLE6e_zA.text: This business determined that I was not an acceptable patron of their establishment. The only thing they had to go off was that they claimed that I was too intoxicated, but I'd like to note that I tend to be a bit of a louder individual and that I had maybe two drinks at dinner and was hoping to get a night cap at Merchant & Trade and thus this was a vastly inaccurate claim. I was hoping to visit this establishment but at this point I have no interest in doing business with this restaurant in the future and will actively not recommend this establishment.

gG6kg1pa2SrJH2Wnl9iyfw.text: Merchant & Trade is trying to hard, and is very underwhelming for what you going in expecting. I went with two other girls on a Tuesday evening for some drinks and appetizers. It was a gorgeous night weather wise and we were looking forward to hanging out on a roof top.  It took us about 15 minutes to get from the bottom of the building to Merchant & Trade because the two bouncers that worked there had us "fake wait" in a line ACROSS from the elevator, not even next to it....in a section by itself. We were the only people waiting. This was absolutely absurd, not sure what message Merchant & Trade is trying to send by making three girls wait behind a velvet rope on a Tuesday when there is more than plenty of available seating upstairs.  Once we were seated we ordered a few drinks which were very disappointing. I ordered the pineapple vodka cocktail, insanely sweet and anything but smooth. My friend ordered a dirty martini with blue cheese olives which were stale. After that we played it safe and ordered a Tito's with club soda and lime.... the soda water was flat! The appetizers were OK, the tator tots are very interesting but a little mushy in my opinion. I gave two stars for the view, that is def by far the reason to come here. The view is absolutely gorgeous, and they have very modern fire pits outside which compliments the decor of the bar perfectly.  I gave one additional star for the server assistant, Jaquon (sorry if I am spelling wrong?) Jaquon was BY FAR the nicest, most attentive, and most helpful person who works at this entire establishment.

7oMMzCjC4aXu3faidWYIag.text: Love the atmosphere and the upscale vibe here. Glad they have a strict dress code enforced- keeps it classy. Came here for a couple cocktails on a beautiful night and loved it. Will be returning soon!

eJx6FGICnNn4Lt2IJE1kkw.text: Avoid this place at all costs.   If you are in Charlotte and want a better view of the city with much better food, check out Fahrenheit.  With regard to M&T, their management is awful.  They keep a big line out front to generate interest.  They have an OVERLY strict dress code that isn't consistent.  Their cocktails are overpriced and awful.

W-akCxTEf4JT-ATgujNv-w.text: This place by far one of the best spot for panoramic views. Stopped in for a drink last night. Def like the ambiance, highly recommend.

nig0q3gDLcZxTgzKjgzPFA.text: Merchant & Trade - hmmm what do I say here? Well let's start with if you're going to have a dress code make sure your door checker has fashion sense, also make sure they aren't biased, or show preference. If your suit as a door checker is 4 sizes to big I'm fairly certain you'll have a hard time judging the rest of us, and by the looks of the outfits let in I'd say I'm right. Now they aren't to blame there, sooo scratch dress code and do more business! Also I suggest your wait staff not be so nasty or stuck up, it's unbecoming. The drinks are good though and the view is really cool.

TwVPZ_beNAy-uRtU6ZoBqA.text: First time at Merchant and Trade and what a view!  Tried the Lamb Meatballs, duck Bao buns, crab buns , and vanilla bean pot de Creme.  Also had a nice cocktails Old Fashioned And Whiskey Sour.  All was very good and the service was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Whiskey Sour

2a0RUqHbeeZGnzQeJy5SOg.text: Excellent service, great views and a sunny afternoon made this place the perfect stop for a bottle of prosecco. The only con is certain spots at certain times get a lot of sun and make for a very warm experience.

SANwQidOjzOe8dKXt1XvKg.text: Very nice place ambiance wise and the views are great. Seating is very comfy. Food was meh, I had the chicken sandwich, and I stuck with wine. I want to go back and try more of their drinks and maybe different food and cocktails  Our waitress was not very attentive

jI5zO-lfLVj58RQ1-3X5CQ.text: I went there for the outside rooftop bar but it was raining so it was closed. However I was hungry so I had the Ramen which was not the best Ramen I've ever had but it was OK. The ambience is quite nice and the wait staff was very nice and accommodating. The DJ was also on point playing old hip-hop and knew how to mix.  Five stars for the ambience location dj hostess and waitress

Thuxc7Ps4v0wpDZ3YNzRHw.text: Turned away from the bar in Charlotte, NC because you're not wearing a "collared shirt".  First...  It's Charlotte.   Second...  It's Charlotte.  Best of luck with your business.

0uMy3jg3ReNNO2opZE9fsw.text: Good cheese plate, good cocktails & ambience. Friendly servers. If you haven't been, you must check this place out.

1hNT4gBVo5tyJdfSKX1jJA.text: Fantastic rooftop patio with skyline views.  Food was respectable but service touch and go.  We were told a drink was out and selected another but it arrived well into the meal.  Prices a bit steep for the portion size.  Maybe better as an end of evening destination for a final drink, and order at the bar.

9tATorSdPCRERarTHsEb-A.text: M&T is bullshit!! They are overrated. They made me waited in line, but there were no reservations. We were with a close friend named, Sal. This was the place of recommendation and a place to be! We asked Sal to take us here, but they were so rude and unprofessional.. I was expecting so much from here but it was such a disappointment and Sal decided to take his business elsewhere! And, BRIAN said, "We [M&T] don't want you YOUR BUSINESS."

x0mR7cKWqGnHCmABsXCh2g.text: If there was an option for zero stars, it would be a more accurate review.   To keep this short, M&T had blocked two of my friends due to the "sporty" nature of their loafers (remember, this is Charlotte, the cultural hotbed of the southeast). They were enforcing a dress code expecting 100% of their patrons to be dressed in cocktail attire, as this is what the normal Charlottean looks like on a Thursday night.   Once we made it past the bouncers, the bar itself was underwhelming, close to empty, and took forever to make overpriced drinks and undercooked food.   If you want to spend a nice evening setting cash on fire and playing Russian roulette with salmonella, Merchant & Trade is the spot for you. If you are a decent human being that just wants a good drink, go to literally any place outside of uptown.

DvzvmYZ8p-LGQ6vzNGhRjw.text: Don't bother...  They might let you in, or they might not! I went with my 26 year-old son and his girlfriend from out of town...he was dressed in nice slacks and a collared shirt and gray canvas Nike tennis shoes. But since they were Nike, a branded athletic shoe, they wouldn't let him in. I had already opened a bar tab and gotten a table.   They did however let in two men with T-shirts, shorts and Adidas sneakers.  Don't waste your time, there are plenty of other upscale spots in uptown Charlotte.

qfMpaWcNZMVxwgVGJ6CPSA.text: A very neat and cool atmosphere! It was crowded but service was not slow. The seating was comfortable and had a very trendy vibe. The bartenders were not the friendliest and drinks were way over priced. It was cold outside but when it is warm the outside part of the roof will be amazing. It has fire places outside and a great view of the city.

lpIg4rAzl4gPPNuyVoGbqg.text: "We want you to look good and feel good, bring your best next time"   There won't be a next time. I'm not wearing "dress clothes" when I'm in them for work. The point of going out is to have a good time and relax.

zsFqEGScw1oSPXl91hhWSQ.text: Wearing an Andy Warhol T (DURING THE DAY) After watching a white woman with hiking boots and a backpack walk up 10 mins before. Was denied access because of the t shirt I'm wearing featured below. Not the first time I've watched a black person be turned away for while simultaneously watch another person gain access in the same attire.

590kPV6JAiQ91p6v0ycKwQ.text: Great view of the city and excellent staff, definitely would recommend this spot for a booze drink or multiple.

pnIOyHMgrQamat9gcP0Diw.text: This place is very reminiscent of the rooftop bar I visited while in Las Vegas, Nevada. Upon entry you are greeted by a guard who checks your ID and stamps your hand. Next you're whisked off to an elevator where another guard has to input your floor destination. There are no floor call buttons inside of the elevator. When you arrive on the 19th floor there is a hostess stand that leads into the establishment. Unlike other bars where you can leisurely walk in and step up to the bar and order a drink, you have to be seated and served at a table or seated at the bar.  The space is very open and airy with a covered bar area and open roof seating with a fire pit. Gorgeous city view. There are few TVs throughout but none of them were on at the time.  The service was good and prompt. We enjoyed the fact that all of the juices at the bar were freshly squeezed, so our drinks were super delicious. We ordered the kale chips just to have something to snack on. The chips were crisp and flavorful, but a little messy to eat with all of the loose shaved Parmesan cheese on top. Also be careful of any draft winds. They will knock over your chips and spill them out on the table.  Overall this seemed like a very chill place to hang out after work with a few people. I went on a Thursday afternoon, but I could really see the place transforming over the weekend with a different crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Merchant & Trade - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fire pit with a view

yeE94D-N-R8qB_DbTtHzwQ.text: I was very disappointed. The ambiance and interior are great but the food is over priced and average at best. We had the calamari and short rib pasta and neither were particularly good. Won't be coming back any time soon.

-j5ZuE1a8y-NpU07hp2shg.text: I have previously visited merchant and trade and had a pleasant experience, however on  St. Patrick's weekend a group of individuals  and I had an uncomfortable experience. Upon being "granted" access to the main area, we sat at a table that did not have any signage indicating approach a waitress or hostess, we remained seated for 15 minutes and not a single person approached to take a drink order. Instead one of the individuals i was with had to approach the bar. I left, completely annoyed at the experience. I approached security to get the name of the manager, and I instead was confronted with a security guard and other staff who said the issue was based on my actions saying I should have stopped at the hostess table, which we did. Upon refusing to say the managers name I contacted the restaurant directly and was put on an indefinite hold. I had to call again to speak to a hostess, never a manager, who reassured me seating policy is ever changing. Ultimately, this review may go unnoticed but in the future I hope this location can have better communication amongst its staff and management to ensure such misunderstanding never happens again.  It is so unfortunate that a place with a great view and atmosphere can have such poor customer service.

ykTwBdw1GMw3W8VV6L0eKw.text: I wish I could give Merchant & Trade 5 stars I really do. From first arriving the bouncer/doorman and the elevator hostess were so friendly & inviting, we were even joking around with the doorman before the elevator came. We get to the top and we are greeted by another friendly hostess & we ask to be seated outside. She escorted us to a table & informed us that our server would be right there. 5 stars so far for M&T especially with the retractable cover so we could enjoy the view even though it was drizzling.  We were seating talking and taking in this gorgeous rooftop bar and the beautiful view! Our waitress finally comes but she hands us our menus and walks away, like barely greets us. The whole time she was very inattentive and our drinks kept taking forever to come out. Then me & a friend had ordered the same drink twice and both times one was extremely lower than the other. When we asked her she said it was the ice but both glasses where filled to the top with ice that you could see haven't melted yet. Then she stated "well I don't know I didn't make them I just put the order in" with a very rude attitude. If the rest of night had been mediocre I would not go back but she is the reason I would give this place a 2.5 rating because service is everything I especially for a brand new business. I will go back but if the service is this bad again, I can't say there would be a third time supporting this establishment.

dRNFvCDt53PKd-3ooKL4YQ.text: My girls and I went here for the first time on a Thursday night. The atmosphere was very welcoming and we literally felt as if we were in another city. The rooftop vibe is just what Charlotte needs! I gave it 4 stars as it took quite some time to get my glass of prosecco, even after asking for it again. Otherwise, I will definitely be back!
